resources.name: [format('AVD-vNet-{0}', parameters('time'))]

metadata.description: Required. The Virtual Network (vNet) Name.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Required. An Array of 1 or more IP Address Prefixes for the Virtual Network.
Optional. An Array of subnets to deploy to the Virtual Network.
Optional. DNS Servers associated to the Virtual Network.

Optional. Resource ID of the DDoS protection plan to assign the VNET to. If it's left blank, DDoS protection will not be configured. If it's provided, the VNET created by this template will be attached to the referenced DDoS protection plan. The DDoS protection plan can exist in the same or in a different subscription.
Optional. Virtual Network Peerings configurations
Optional. Specifies the number of days that logs will be kept for; a value of 0 will retain data indefinitely.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.
Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID). This GUID must be previously registered
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed.

Required. The name of the parent virtual network
Required. The address prefix for the subnet.

Optional. Resource Group where NSGs are deployed, if different than VNET Resource Group.
Optional. The route table to assign to the subnet
Optional. The service endpoints to enable on the subnet
Optional. The delegations to enable on the subnet
Optional. The name of the NAT Gateway to use for the subnet
Optional. enable or disable apply network policies on private end point in the subnet.
Optional. enable or disable apply network policies on private link service in the subnet.
Optional. List of address prefixes for the subnet.

Optional. Array of IpAllocation which reference this subnet
Optional. An array of service endpoint policies.

The name of the virtual network peering
The resource ID of the virtual network peering
The address prefix for the subnet
List of address prefixes for the subnet
Optional. The Name of Vnet Peering resource. If not provided, default value will be localVnetName-remoteVnetName
Required. The Name of the Virtual Network to add the peering to.
Required. The Resource ID of the VNet that is this Local VNet is being peered to. Should be in the format of a Resource ID
Optional. Whether the forwarded traffic from the VMs in the local virtual network will be allowed/disallowed in remote virtual network. Default is true
Optional. If gateway links can be used in remote virtual networking to link to this virtual network. Default is false
Optional. Whether the VMs in the local virtual network space would be able to access the VMs in remote virtual network space. Default is true
Optional. If we need to verify the provisioning state of the remote gateway. Default is true

Optional. If remote gateways can be used on this virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and allowGatewayTransit on remote peering is also true, virtual network will use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network already has a gateway. Default is false
Optional. Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID). This GUID must be previously registered

metadata.description: Required. Name of the Host Pool
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. The friendly name of the Host Pool to be created.
Optional. The description of the Host Pool to be created.
Optional. Set this parameter to Personal if you would like to enable Persistent Desktop experience. Defaults to Pooled.
Optional. Set the type of assignment for a Personal Host Pool type
Optional. Type of load balancer algorithm.
Optional. Maximum number of sessions.
Optional. Host Pool RDP properties

Optional. Whether to use validation enviroment. When set to true, the Host Pool will be deployed in a validation 'ring' (environment) that receives all the new features (might be less stable). Ddefaults to false that stands for the stable, production-ready environment.
Optional. The necessary information for adding more VMs to this Host Pool.
Optional. Host Pool token validity length. Usage: 'PT8H' - valid for 8 hours; 'P5D' - valid for 5 days; 'P1Y' - valid for 1 year. When not provided, the token will be valid for 8 hours.
Generated. Do not provide a value! This date value is used to generate a registration token.
Optional. Specifies the number of days that logs will be kept for; a value of 0 will retain data indefinitely.

Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID). This GUID must be previously registered
Optional. The type of preferred application group type, default to Desktop Application Group
Optional. Enable Start VM on connect to allow users to start the virtual machine from a deallocated state. Important: Custom RBAC role required to power manage VMs.
Optional. Validation host pool allows you to test service changes before they are deployed to production.
